cyclone.name: MARCO
cyclone.current_location: about 30 miles NNE of Cabo Gracias a Dios on the Nicaragua/Honduras border
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to move northwest, cross the Yucatán Peninsula Saturday night, then track north-northwest across the central Gulf toward the north-central Gulf Coast early next week

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch from Punta Herrero to Cancún, Mexico
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning along the northern Nicaragua & Honduras coasts and from Punta Herrero to Cancún, Mexico
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire northern Gulf Coast from Texas through the Florida Panhandle is within the 5-day impact swath
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds are possible (10–27% chance) late Tuesday into early Wednesday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected given current east-of-port track.
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rainbands could bring 1–2 inches of rain to Galveston around landfall time.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Rough seas and high surf may affect vessel operations beginning late Monday.
